alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 3:53AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Suwannee and south central Hamilton Counties through 445 AM EST... At 352 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dowling Park to 11 miles southwest of Perry. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. Some of the storms were exhibiting weak rotation. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Suwannee Springs, Dowling Park, Luraville, Newburn and Houston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EST for northern Florida.
